et: Middle English {it}tempestuous,{/it} Latinization of {it}tempestous,{/it} borrowed from Anglo-French, re-formation of Late Latin {it}tempestuōsus,{/it} from {it}tempestu-,{/it} probably extracted from Latin {it}tempestūt-, tempestūs,{/it} archaic variant of {it}tempestāt-, tempestās{/it} "stretch of time, season, weather, {et_link|tempest:1|tempest:1}" + {it}-ōsus{/it} {et_link|-ous|-ous}
shortdef: of, relating to, or resembling a tempest : turbulent, stormy
